body.name: Everyone Here Is Lying: A Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #5,260 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #30 in Women's Crime Fiction #36 in Women's Psychological Fiction #264 in Psychological Thrillers (Kindle Store)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The oft-overused word "Unputdownable" certainly applies here. The book quickly establishes what seems to be a simple situation, but immediately introduces complications that enmesh a small ensemble of characters in an ever-expanding web of lies, and it is impossible to stop reading until all the whys and wherefores are revealed. And when the final showdown happens, unlike a lot of books that require pages and pages of boring explanation and loose-end-tying, this one is so skilfully written none of that is necessary and it stays intriguing to the end. I was going to subtract one star for its abrupt ending - I wanted to know what happened afterwards! But I decided to give it full marks because it was such a good read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Keeps you guessing
reviews.reviewText: Everyone here is lying is just the beginning of the tale of this small town. Dysfunctional families, an affair that has unforseen results, and a little girl who doesn't act like an innocent child. The ending will leave you with WHAT?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really great book for the most part but then the ending felt very rushed. Lots of loose ends left too so not a very satisfying finish.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Edge of your seat thriller
reviews.reviewText: This story grabbed me from page one. I could not put this book down!! Read it! You will love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: ‘23 - 4 STARS; could have been 5 stars with a different ending!DESCRIPTION : Welcome to Stanhope! A safe neighborhood. A place for families.William Wooler is a family man, on the surface. But he’s been having an affair, an affair that ended horribly this afternoon at a motel up the road. So when he returns to his house, devastated and angry, to find his difficult nine-year-old daughter, Avery, unexpectedly home from school, William loses his temper. Hours later, Avery’s family declares her missing. Suddenly Stanhope doesn’t feel so safe. And William isn’t the only one on his street who’s hiding a lie. As witnesses come forward with information that may or may not be true, Avery's neighbors become increasingly unhinged. Who took Avery Wooler?REVIEW :Prior books by this author for me were Not A Happy Family (‘21 - 4 Stars), The End of Her ('20 - 4 Stars), Someone We Knew (‘19 - 4 Stars), An Unwanted Guest ('18 - 3 Stars), A Stranger in the House ('17 - 4 Stars) and The Couple Next Door ('16 - Read '17 - 4 Stars).Ms. Lapena is one of my authors that just ropes you in right away. Like the title says, there are sooo many secrets and some people are enjoying this tragedy just a little too much. Ms. Lapena’s writing is soooo good, the plot is almost secondary. Kept me guessing and trying to decide who I think is guilty and then BAM ! WHAT ! I can’t wait to see where this goes! Loved the curvy path this book took to the end.Two books in a row for me that were 5-stars but got dropped to 4 stars because of the endings. This book and Strange Sally Diamond by Liz Nugent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Welcome to Stanhope. A safe neighborhood. A place for families.William Wooler is a family man, on the surface. But he’s been having an affair, an affair that ended horribly this afternoon at a motel up the road. So when he returns to his house, devastated and angry, to find his difficult nine-year-old daughter, Avery, unexpectedly home from school, William loses his temper.Hours later, Avery’s family declares her missing.Suddenly Stanhope doesn’t feel so safe. And William isn’t the only one on his street who’s hiding a lie. As witnesses come forward with information that may or may not be true, Avery’s neighbors become increasingly unhinged.Who took Avery Wooler?Nothing will prepare you for the truth.MY THOUGHTS:What can happen in a safe neighborhood, and why are the characters of Everyone Here Is Lying doing everything in their power to keep secrets?It all began with a secret love affair, and a difficult child sent home from school after misbehaving.A day when one woman breaks up with her lover, sending him home early that day. And when a child is dismissed from school because of her terrible behavior.Avery walks home from school after being dismissed, and her father walks in on her afterwards. They argue, he slaps her, and then everything changes.Does he leave, or does he take her away?When nobody knows what happened to Avery, the police search and question everyone on the street.Many of the neighborhood are connected in one way or another. When answers are not forthcoming, we are left to wonder.As the story unfolds, the reader is glued to the pages. A 5 star read.***

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Family Drama and Lots of Suspense
reviews.reviewText: A quiet upper middle class neighborhood explodes with drama when nine-year old Avery goes missing after school one day. There were plenty of suspicious characters who could have taken her, including her own father. And there are a ton of secrets exposed as the story unravels. None of the characters was particularly likable but some were relatable. My favorite character happened to be Avery’s brother Michael, a victim in his own way because he blamed himself for her disappearance. The plot was moderately well-paced, with a few twists and a real surprise at the end. Good suspense and excellent domestic drama.I checked out this book from the local library using the Libby App. All opinions expressed are my own.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book was captivating from the very beginning to the very last page! It will keep you up at night wanted to see what happens.
Me llegó la portada rota y en mal estado

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very good book indeed! Gripping and fast moving. I wouldn’t say the plot or story line is too sophisticated, but it makes this book very quick and easy to read. Allows you to switch off and relax.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not EVERYONE was lying... so 4 stars.
reviews.reviewText: I expected everyone in this "who done it" to be lying... but not the case... Otherwise a great read!
I'm huge fan of Shari Lapena and had been waiting for this novel for so long but didn't enjoy this as much as other novels.
